title: HTML Fundamentals for Web Development
description: Learn the building blocks of web development by mastering HTML structure, elements, and creating your first web pages.
subject: Elective ICT
achievementDescription: Create structured web pages using HTML fundamentals

text.introduction: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of all websites. It provides the structure and content of web pages using a system of tags and elements. Learning HTML is the first step toward becoming a web developer and understanding how the internet works.

sections.title: What is HTML?
sections.content:
**HTML Basics:** • **H**yper**T**ext **M**arkup **L**anguage • Standard language for creating web pages • Uses tags to structure content • Works with CSS for styling and JavaScript for interactivity **HTML Structure:** ```html My Ghana Website

Welcome to Ghana

This is my first webpage!

``` **Key Components:** • **:** Tells browser this is HTML5 • **:** Root element containing all content • **:** Contains metadata (not displayed) • **:** Contains visible page content • **Tags:** Keywords enclosed in angle brackets • **Elements:** Complete tag pairs with content

sections.title: HTML Attributes
sections.content:
**What are Attributes?** • Additional information about elements • Written inside opening tags • Come in name="value" pairs • Modify element behavior or appearance **Common Attributes:** • **id**: Unique identifier for element • **class**: Groups elements for styling • **src**: Source file for images/media • **href**: Destination for links • **alt**: Alternative text for images • **title**: Tooltip text on hover **Examples:** ```html Visit Ghana.gov.gh
Header content

Important announcement

``` **Best Practices:** • Always use alt attributes for images • Use meaningful id and class names • Quote all attribute values • Keep attributes organized and readable

sections.title: Creating Your First Ghana Website
sections.content:
**Project: Ghana Tourism Page**

**Step 1: Basic Structure**
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <title>Visit Ghana - Gateway to Africa</title>
</head>
<body>
  <!-- Content goes here -->
</body>
</html>
```

**Step 2: Add Content**
• Header with Ghana flag and title
• Navigation menu
• Main content sections
• Images of tourist attractions
• Footer with contact information

**Step 3: Use Semantic HTML**
• `<header>`: Top section with title/logo
• `<nav>`: Navigation menu
• `<main>`: Primary content area
• `<section>`: Themed content blocks
• `<article>`: Independent content pieces
• `<footer>`: Bottom section with info

**Step 4: Test Your Page**
• Open in different browsers
• Check all links work
• Verify images display correctly
• Validate HTML using W3C validator

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag creates the largest heading, with headings getting smaller from h1 to h6.

questions.question: What does the 'alt' attribute in an tag provide?
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text that describes the image for accessibility and when images can't load.

exercises.title: Ghana School Website
exercises.instructions: Create a complete HTML page for a Ghanaian school including header, navigation, content sections, and footer.
exercises.hint: Use semantic HTML5 elements and include proper headings, lists, links, and images.

exercises.title: HTML Code Review
exercises.instructions: Review and fix HTML code samples, identifying and correcting common errors.
exercises.hint: Check for proper tag closure, attribute formatting, and semantic structure.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana National Museum Website
scenarioChallenges.scenario: The Ghana National Museum wants to create their first website to showcase Ghana's rich history and cultural artifacts. They need a professional, informative website that highlights their exhibits, provides visitor information, and educates people about Ghana's heritage.
tasks: Create a complete HTML structure with semantic elements
Design a homepage featuring museum highlights
Build an exhibits page with artifact descriptions and images
Create a visitor information page with hours, location, and contact details
Add a Ghanaian history timeline using lists and headings
Include proper navigation between all pages
Ensure all content is accessible with proper alt text and headings
Validate HTML code for web standards compliance
learningObjectives: Apply HTML fundamentals to create a multi-page website
Implement proper navigation and link structure
Create accessible web content following best practices
Understand the role of HTML in preserving and sharing cultural heritage
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: The Ghana National Museum, located in Accra, houses important artifacts and exhibits that tell the story of Ghana's rich history, from ancient kingdoms to independence and beyond.
